meanings.definition: Not able to be supported or justified.
meanings.sent1: The weight of the giant boulder was unsupportable for the tiny ant.
meanings.sent2: The flimsy rope was unsupportable for climbing the steep cliff.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit all those toys in the small box was unsupportable!
meanings.sent4: The fragile bridge was unsupportable under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent5: The leaky boat was unsupportable in the stormy sea.

meanings.definition: Unable to be upheld or maintained.
meanings.sent1: The unsupportable roof collapsed under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent2: The old building's unsupportable structure led to its demolition.
meanings.sent3: His unsupportable argument crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: The unsupportable relationship finally fell apart.
meanings.sent5: The unsupportable lie unraveled during questioning.
